docs.abstract: Dr Irwin Redlener letter on March 24 article notes that higher rates of obesity are evident in poor children
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Diagnosis: Supersize'' (Week in Review, March 24): While rates of obesity are rising among all children, we are seeing higher rates of obesity and diabetes in poor children. Compounding the problem are cuts in physical education programs, the proliferation of vending machines in schools and a lack of safe play environments.
